newsitem.title: ITALY: Carnival receives world largest cruise ship.
newsitem.headline: Carnival receives world largest cruise ship.

text.p: Carnival Corp has taken delivery of the "Carnival Destiny', the world's largest cruise ship, after its completion by Italian shipbuilder Fincantieri.
Fincantieri said it had handed over the 100,000 plus gross tonnne ship, which is taller than the Statue of Liberty, on Saturday in a ceremony at its Monfalcone shipyard in northeastern Italy.
"The "Carnival Destiny' is the world's largest passenger ship of all time," said a statement from Fincantieri, part of state industrial holding IRI.
No price was given for the 270-metre vessel, which was completed in 20 months and is big enough for 3,400 passengers and 1,000 crew with 16 decks and 1,320 cabins, most of which had ocean views.
The cruise liner also has a nine-deck high atrium, a theatre seating 1,600 people, two restaurants of 1,050 and 750 seats and four swimming pools.
Fincantieri, which has chalked up three consecutive years of profits after years in the red, said its current order books included nine vessels for an aggregate value of 5.5 trillion lire.
The largest cruise ship had previously been the 77,000 tonne "Sun Princess' owned by P&O's Princess Cruises U.S. unit, which Fincantieri handed over last November.
